byline.original: By J. DAVID GOODMAN and AL BAKER

lead_paragraph: Mr. Bratton, the most widely recognized face in American policing, will take a job in the private sector and be replaced by the department’s top uniformed officer, Chief James P. O’Neill.

headline.print_headline: Bratton Is Out as Police Chief for New York
headline.main: William Bratton, New York’s Influential Police Commissioner, Is Stepping Down

snippet: Mr. Bratton, the most widely recognized face in American policing, will take a job in the private sector and be replaced by the department’s top uniformed officer, Chief James P. O’Neill....
abstract: New York Police Dept Commissioner William J Bratton will step down in September to take job with private advisory firm, ending 45-year public service career; will be replaced by Police Chief James P O'Neill; departure raises questions about direction and continuity in department that, like other law enforcement agencies across country, is facing pressure to address police brutality.
